holidays.name: Festivus
holidays.description: A holiday invented as a humorous alternative to the pressures and commercialism of the Christmas season, featuring the iconic 'Airing of Grievances' and 'Feats of Strength.'
holidays.origin: Created by writer Dan O'Keefe and popularized by the TV show "Seinfeld" in 1997.
holidays.funFact: Festivus became so popular that it inspired actual celebrations around the world, complete with an unadorned aluminum pole instead of a Christmas tree.

holidays.name: National Pfeffernusse Day
holidays.description: A celebration of the tiny spicy German cookies called Pfeffernusse, traditionally enjoyed during the holiday season.
holidays.origin: Pfeffernusse cookies hail from Germany and the name means 'pepper nut,' referencing the warm spices used in the recipe.
holidays.funFact: Pfeffernusse cookies can last for weeks, making them perfect for long holiday celebrations and sharing with friends and family!

holidays.name: Roots Day
holidays.description: A day to honor and celebrate family roots, heritage, and genealogy, encouraging people to explore their ancestry and traditions.
holidays.origin: An informal observance without a clear origin, rising in popularity with genealogy enthusiasts especially during the holiday season.
holidays.funFact: Many people embark on family history research during Roots Day, inspired by the idea of 'coming home for the holidays' and connecting with their past.

holidays.name: DNA Day
holidays.description: A lesser-known informal day to appreciate DNA and genetics, often marked by quirky science events and discussions of what makes each person unique.
holidays.origin: Coinciding with the completion of the Human Genome Project announced in April 2003, some communities celebrate this in December for quirky fun.
holidays.funFact: DNA Day sometimes features events where participants look at their own genetic traits, like why some people roll their tongues or have attached earlobes!
